intro: Polygonum patulum, commonly known as broadleaf knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Asia. It features rhizomatous growth and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is sometimes considered invasive in certain regions. Its botanical characteristics make it a common species in wetland and riparian habitats.
